.git/hooks/applypatch-msg.sample

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/bin/sh
00002 #
00003 # An example hook script to check the commit log message taken by
00004 # applypatch from an e-mail message.
00005 #
00006 # The hook should exit with non-zero status after issuing an
00007 # appropriate message if it wants to stop the commit.  The hook is
00008 # allowed to edit the commit message file.
00009 #
00010 # To enable this hook, rename this file to "applypatch-msg".
00011 
00012 . git-sh-setup
00013 test -x "$GIT_DIR/hooks/commit-msg" &&
00014     exec "$GIT_DIR/hooks/commit-msg" ${1+"$@"}
00015 :
